parallel.distributed

Interface DMsgIntf

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DBarrierAddRequest, DBarrierRequest, DBarrierRmRequest, DFileAccessSrvStatsRequest, DFileDataVectorReadRequest, DRecvMsg, DRLockGetRequest, DRLockReleaseRequest, DSendMsg, DWLockGetRequest, DWLockReleaseRequest

    public interface DMsgIntf
extends java.io.Serializable
    DMsgIntf objects are meant to transport over Socket wires sendData() and/or recvData() requests, as those are defined in the parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator class, which is in fact the class used to "transfer" message data between the threads in the parallel.distributed.DMsgPassingCoordinatorSrv class. Not part of the public API (despite the public status).

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void execute(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
      if the object is a DSendMsg calls the sendData() method on an appropriate parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator and once the data are safely sent, it sends back to the other end of the connecting socket an parallel.distributed.OKReply object, else if it's a DRecvMsg, calls the recvData() and once data are received, sends them to the other end of the socket.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        void execute(java.io.ObjectOutputStream oos)
             throws ParallelException,
                    java.io.IOException
        if the object is a DSendMsg calls the sendData() method on an appropriate parallel.MsgPassingCoordinator and once the data are safely sent, it sends back to the other end of the connecting socket an parallel.distributed.OKReply object, else if it's a DRecvMsg, calls the recvData() and once data are received, sends them to the other end of the socket.
